response_parsed.title: Testing Strategies for XML Code with pytest in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This document provides a comprehensive guide on testing XML code using pytest, a popular Python testing framework, in Python 3.12+. It covers key points, code examples, version notes, and caveats related to testing XML data structures with pytest.
key_points: Understanding the role of pytest for testing
Utilizing third-party libraries for parsing and manipulating XML data
Writing test cases for different scenarios in your XML files
Implementing fixtures for setting up and teardown of test environments

code_examples.code:
import pytest, xml.etree.ElementTree as ET

def test_xml_file():
    tree = ET.parse('test.xml')
    root = tree.getroot()
    assert len(root) == 10

Test your XML files in a modular fashion, separating each test case or scenario.
